taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section flagellares;species nefrens;

treatment.other_name: (unable to bite; presumably meaning unable to scratch)
treatment.description: Resembling no. 16 but with flowering pedicels and petioles of bracteal leaves densely spreading-villous; canes with remote subulate prickles only 1-2.5 mm. long; petioles unarmed or with remote bristles1-2 mm. long; primocane-leaves firm-membranaceous, the terminal ovate leaflet acuminate-tipped; floricane-leaflets merely acute, all leaflets coarsely dentate or dentate-serrate with broad simple or hut slightly notched teeth; larger corymbs with 2-6 flowers on nearly prickleless pedicels up to 7 cm. long. (? R. Steelei Bailey; R. multifer Bailey)
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Dry open soil or thin woods, N.Y. to Minn., s. to Va., Tenn. and Okla. Fl. May, early June; fr. mid-June, July.
